item.description:
Each player is a tourist visiting beautiful New Zealand. The winner is the first player to stop at all his destinations AND return overseas to the SAME staring place.

The board has a map of New Zealand with real towns and cities are represented as spaces on the board which players move between.

At the start of the game players are randomly dealt destinations cards which they must visit during the course of play.

Movement is done in one of three ways. Rolling the dice, moving one space on the board or, if their pawn is on an N.A.C. Aircentre, by flying to a randomly determined destination on their choice of the North or South island.

If a players lands on another players pawn they may give them one of their already visited destinations and that player must then add that destination to their itinerary to be completed before they can complete the game.

name.value: Wieso? Weshalb? Warum? Tiere: Das pfiffige Wissensspiel

item.description:
How do crocodile babies come into the world? If a hamster awake at night? Where is the hedgehog in winter ? With knowledge, a little luck and a good memory you collect the most chips. By the way you will learn interesting facts about the animal world.

To play the game, 30 image tokens need to be assign to the correct one of the 5 theme tables, with each player revealing two tokens on his turn and chosing one. If you manage to place your tokens on the marked spots, you earn victory points.

name.value: Wieso? Weshalb? Warum? Unsere Welt: Das pfiffige Wissensspiel

item.description:
Why are bananas curved? Do children live in the desert ? Who lives in an igloo? With knowledge, luck and a good memory you collect the most chips. By the way you will learn interesting facts about our world.

To play the game, 30 image tokens need to be assign to the correct one of the 5 theme tables, with each player revealing two tokens on his turn and chosing one. If you manage to place your tokens on the marked spots, you earn victory points.

A bizarre and ingenious party game where you have to 'do things' without being accused by the other players. Be sneaky, act crazy, manipulate the group and get creative if you want to win!

The game consists of a deck of 2 types of playing cards:
DUELS to play during your turn. Choose your opponent, battle it out, and the group decides the winner.
...but that's just to keep the game going, the 'DO SOMETHING' cards are what it's all about! These are instructions you have to carry out during the other players' turns in such a way that they can verify it happened when you confess BUT if they call you out, you'll have to try again.

DEER LORD! is a social game, and the opinions of the players determine the gameplay. Win over your friends to win the game!

This BASIC game fits any occasion and is suitable for any type of player. If you're looking to spice it up, add one or more of the 3 expansions.

link.value: Deer Lord! For Fame and for Game

item.description:
From the introduction:'

Battles for the Galactic Empire is a two-player game. Players attempt to outwit and outplay their opponent to achieve victory by scoring Chaos points. Chaos points are scored through control of the six regions in the sector. Control of the regions is determined by skillful deployment of space fleets, play of action chits, and tactical choices during combat. Players build their fleets choosing among six types with varying capabilities including military, morphogenetic (ability to convert opposing forces to the friendly side), and deployment/movement options. They pick chits randomly from 5 categories to enhance movement, tactical and build abilities, recruit special units, and disrupt opponent's plans."

Theme and goal
In Miner the players steps in the role of hardworking Miners. The Miners are searching for resources like gold and iron on a 3D Game Board. To be more efficient they have to upgrade their shovels and pickaxes and can buy additional ropes. With negotiation skills they have to sell the mined resources on the market. 
The player which earns the most money wins the game.

Gameplay
The special thing about Miner is its unique 3D sandbox in the middle of the game board. The sandbox includes 180 massive resource blocks. Hidden under soil there are stone, coal, iron and gold, that want to be discovered. The player steps in the role of a miner. With negotiating skill they try to sell the mined resources on the market for a good price. 
 Each round a player has 10 hours to perform actions. Every action costs time, which is displayed on the player’s game tableau. When there is no time left the player can knock off work and the next player begins his turn. 
 What actions a player can choose?
The key element of the game is the 3D sandbox. Inside of it every player has a game character. In the sandbox the player can move, climb or mine resources. In the beginning of the game all players are standing on soil, but the deeper they dig, the more exciting it will be.

But that's easier said than done. Every player starts with only one rope. So if you want to dig deeper you should better buy some additional ropes in the town. With the mined resources you can go to the market. But be careful, the prices shown by the resource dice are changing every round. When you don’t want to sell the mined resources you have to store them in a warehouse. Every player owns a warehouse on his private deck. There are also 4 warehouses in the town available which can be rented.

If you want to rank among the best, you soon have to go to the forge and buy better tools. Of course some coins have to be reinvested but with better pickaxe your mining will be much more efficient.

If there is some time left, you can work for the day laborer to earn some coins or you can visit the tavern. In the tavern you can get some benefit cards which can really make the difference.

With all these actions you can plan your turn. If there is no time left you have to wait for the next round. Plan your turns clever and you will have the right resources at the right time. The player who owns the most coins after 14 rounds wins the game.

A sadistic film crew. Tribes of unforgiving cannibals. A battle of unparalleled brutality. 2 players MUST fight to the death in a jungle of HORRORS where there is only one law: KILL OR BE KILLED.

Ferox is an asymmetrical 2-player card battling game inspired by the cannibal exploitation films of the 1970's and 80's. One player controls a film crew that has crashed in a hostile jungle and must escape, the other plays the native tribes intent on destroying any trace of the invaders. Through careful card drafting, hand management, and the manipulation of a shared resource pool, players must outwit each other and achieve their goals at all costs.

item.description: The year 2015 marks the 150th anniversary of the Vienna Ring Road, which circles the Innere Stadt district of Vienna, and Wiener Ringstraße is a tactical dice and collectible card game to celebrate this event and Vienna itself.

Kesse Rüben is a strategic gambling game. The cropland consists of 16 fields, were farmers can plant their own crops. However, before a crop can be planted, first another farmer should be challenged, and bet an unknown number of crops. The winner of the gambling duel can perform a number of actions, like moving to another field, planting an own crop, or removing the crop of another farmer. The farmer who ends up with the highest number of crops, wins the game.

item.description:
Awkward Turtle is an adult party word game with 352 of the most awkward sounding, feeling and looking words English offers. Anything from "penis" to the seemingly benign "moist".

Two teams duke it out in 60 second rounds. The first team to guess enough words correctly to reach 30 points is crowned the "Awkward Turtle Champions"!

Basically it's a crude, adult version of taboo! Try to describe the word on the top of the card without saying the words presented on the bottom of the card!

Features 352 of the most awkward looking, sounding, and feeling words English has to offer.

Are you Llama enough to please your goddess? The Llama Goddess is not a sweet goddess. She likes the fight more than anyone and if you want to gain her respect, you are going to spit til the last drop of drool you have!

Command your Llama around the battlefield, spit the others, gain goddess favor points and try to look clean in order to achieve the higher score!

Llama Fight is a board game for 2-4 players in which you command a Llama with cards. You have 3 different actions: Spit, Move and take towels for later cleaning. Combine them with values and make those actions X times. Everytime you spit, you gain favor goddess points. Two rounds later, the cleanest and devoutest Llama wins the match.

The Icarus Project is a fast paced, narrative driven, sci fi skirmish wargame set over 700 years in the future. Players take control of small groups of elite soldiers, called strike forces, as they try to accomplish a variety of missions including assassinations, prisoner captures, and bomb disposals.

With a focus on narrative, cinematic gameplay, the Icarus Project is a game filled with water-cooler moments that will have you and your friends re-telling the stories for years to come.

Take control of the Galactic Alliance of Humanity, a utilitarian behemoth with the largest military in the galaxy, or command the Nexus, a brutal alien race that wants nothing more than to wipe humanity from the galactic stage.

With a variety of other factions and races, the Icarus Project has something for everyone. The Praesidians are a wise and noble race, and posses some of the most advanced technology in existence. The Ji'tar are iron-willed and don't take kindly to outsiders. And the Mercenary faction allows you to take control of the galaxy's criminals, outlaws, and guns for hire that can be added to any other strike force.

From the publisher:

Working with the player next to you, try to make the other players guess the mystery word! 5, 4, 3, 2, 1 ... Say your clue at the same time as your partner! But be careful: it MUST be different, otherwise you'll lose points! So you'll have to be relevant while remaining original to score the maximum number of points.

item.description:
The Fool's Journey is a tarot-based storytelling game, in which a "journey" of nine cards is constructed collaboratively by the players. Bidding (using the non-trump suits) allows players to compete for the prerogative of decisions about trump placement, and to be awarded dice.

All players are encouraged to provide their own unique narrative interpretations of the journey at the end of the game. Dice won earlier in the game are rolled to determine priority for who gets to tell a story first.

The game requires a copy of the rules, a standard 78-card tarot deck, and "a large pool of six-sided dice (Generally a box of 36 will do)." Pencil and paper are also suggested.

Traitor is a 2-player abstract strategy game. It is played with 10 wooden pawns per side on a wooden board.

Pawns move one square forward or sideways, and capture diagonally. The goal of the game is simply to land one of your pawns on your opponent's back line.

A pawn is chosen at random to be the Traitor. At a specific point in the game, the Traitor is revealed, and it changes allegiance. Your opponent's pawn becomes your pawn to control. But one of your pawns may still be a Traitor, waiting for the perfect time to reveal itself...

Featuring gameplay for 2 or 4 players across a TIE fighter-shaped gameboard, players can determine the fate of the Star Wars universe through 3 concurrent (yet distinct) battles. Choose to play as either the Rebel Alliance or the Galactic Empire, and use the classic Risk dice to control characters and ships. The object of the game is to defend or destroy the Death Star. item.description:
Put yourself in the goblin runner's shoes and take part in a fun and exciting race. Only good reaction and agile mind will help you survive this dangerous race because a huge magic stone is rushing at your heels and will flatten anyone who gets in its way! Roll the dice to earn bonus points and become the fastest on the race track!

Goblin Dice consists of a random number of rounds and continues until one of the players reaches the finish line – winning the game — or the stone flattens everyone except one player, with this final survivor being the winner. Every round, each player rolls two dice and uses any two of them to move or to activate the tile's special feature. Once all of the players have used their dice, the stone behind them moves and tries to smash the last runners. Players do not only move their goblins forward, but they can also activate special features of the tiles, complicating the game for their opponents.

In the economic game Port of Piraeus, you are one of many prudent and provident merchants who have come to the Port of Piraeus from all over the world to sell their goods and purchase overseas items. Every decision you make will inevitably influence the market and either simplify or complicate the game for your opponents. Act carefully, trade proficiently and become the most successful merchant in the Port of Piraeus!

Players become merchants from different countries who are trying to make money buying and selling different commodities. There are eight trading days in the game, and each day players get to choose whether they want to buy other merchants’ products or sell their own. The prices for different products will keep changing depending on the situation. When they arrive back home, each merchant will get a good price for all the goods they buy here!

The player who earns more money by the end of the game becomes the winner.

name.value: Lisbon, The Gate to the World

item.description:
From the publisher's rulebook:

At the beginning of the Fifteenth Century, "the Age of Discovery" was beginning from Portugal. In Lisbon, the merchants have big dreams. They try to get their big chance as a trader with West Africa. In this time, Europeans didn't know about the Americas, they had just started to trade with West Africa. But in Portugal, the "Dinastia de Avis" supported their merchants for the new area.

Players are merchants. They try to gain inï¬‚uence with the Kings "Joan I", "Duarte I", "Pedro" and "Henrique". The players bring the requested goods from West Africa, Madeira and Azores to the Kings. And they also add crews, get support from others, and collect income in “Reals”.

Each player gets resources by putting their own Crew chips on the West Africa boards. By developing the areas, players offer the goods sought by the Kings. In return, they gain Ships and Adventurers to help them. Players also advance their Nobles along the Lisbon track, building Markets, and collecting Crew. Players also get Support Cards in return for Gold.

Each King will pay out Reals to the best merchants. When all the Kings have paid income, the game ends and players collect a final income and bonuses. The richest player is the winner. Try to be the best merchant in Portugal!

name.value: Star Wars Death Star Boom Boom Balloon

item.description:
It's Star Wars Death Star Boom Boom Balloon, the crazy and unpredictable game where at any time the balloon can go BOOM! In this Star Wars Edition, it's a race to destroy the Death Star. Players take turns attacking the Death Star, but no one knows when it will go BOOM! Roll the die, and carefully push in a stick until it clicks. Squeeze and stretch the Death Star - will the next click make it pop? Be the leader with the most X-wing Starfighters in play to win! Bring home the thrill of Boom Boom Balloon - Star Wars Edition!
Star Wars Death Star Boom Boom Balloon is the crazy game where each player tries to keep the balloon from popping!

Basic Idea is the same as Boom Boom Balloon but with a Star Wars Twist

•Roll the die and "click" a Laser stick for each number rolled. Will the Death Star explode? Watch out!

•It's a race to destroy the Death Star! BOOM! Will your Rebel Alliance fleet be the largest when it pops?

•Star Wars Boom Boom Balloon is made for 2-6 players ages 8 and up. No Batteries Required

•Includes: 1 Balloon Frame, 18 X-Wing Starfighters, 12 Death Star Balloons, 1 Die, 9 Laser Sticks, 1 Instruction Sheet, Batteries Not Required

Join Mal, Wash, Zoë, Inara, Kaylee, Jayne, Simon, River, Book, and more as Fluxx enters the 'Verse at full speed. With the rules constantly changing, Firefly Fluxx is just as unpredictable as misbehaving in space!

Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game. There are many editions, themed siblings, and promo cards available.

item.description:
"Once in the lifetime of a system a brilliant enthusiastic comes along and has the talent .. and the ear ... to hear what his fellow hobbyists want in a system. The heart to make it happen. And the work ethic to stay the course. Advanced Tobruk System (ATS) has been blessed with multiple talents, the enduring skills of Drew Dorman, the affable and intelligent 'ATS Guy', Michal Blazejczyk of Virtual ATS, and others. But there is only one EAGLE. And has landed his impressive intellect ... right into the heart of the system. What's more, his efforts were to clarify -- make better -- while keeping it all STABLE as the system enters it's 'baker's dozen year'—with a 12 year run already in the rear-view mirror.

Critical Hit, Inc.'s plan is to return Scott's goodwill to each and every ATSer. A ton of work went into the new edition, and an ATS system relaunch is the result with DOZENS of never published ATS battlefields in the ready room."


A complete 74 page COLOR system rules set, 3-hole punched format. The new rules supersede all previous editions and will be the only version available.

Includes all new EXPANDED INDEX. All examples of play in COLOR.

Three versions available:

 Front and Back color covers in a Binder 
 Non-binder version, to save international customers on postage
 PDF version




(While available, a free copy of the fully searchable E RULEBOOK will be sent to those who order printed versions of the rules)

Also includes:

 Two new 2-sided 11" × 17" folding System Play Aids (3-hole punched and shipped in the rules binder with the binder version)

link.value: ATS Gallabat: The War in East Africa 1940

item.description:
Crabs are the perfect example of what a team should never be. When one is placed in an open crate, it quickly scuttles out. But when multiples are placed in a crate all the other crabs will never let the one escape in their own attempt to climb free.

Crabs in a Crate enjoys the fun hearted frustration of exactly that situation. Trying to be the ONE to escape when there is more than just you in the crate. Players will do their best to help their crab escape by playing cards that let them push, pull, piggyback and climb their way out of the crate. "Why not play nice and just race to the top?" one might ask. Escaping isn't the only way to win, if you are the crab to gain the most points by pulling down their opponents you can win!
Game can handle 3-6 players in a thirty-ish minute game.

This is the ultimate party game of revealing truths. This racy game provides instant fun for 6 to 20 players in the most stimulating, thought-provoking, hilarious, intriguing, invasive, exciting way ever! This game will eliminate attractiveness while heightening the likability of the players. Whether you are married, single, dating, in-between, just kicking with friends, straight, LGBT, or Green... this game is for you. Dating will never be any easier after playing the Last 2 Standing!
 It's simple! Remain standing in the game by answering a series of intuitive unisex questions that will certainly put you at the edge of your seat with a lot of "Ah-Ha" moments, and you will be crowned as a winner. Choose a moderator. Split into sides (i.e Men vs Women). Get a token. Place the tokens on the board. Roll the die. Select a card from 1 of the 6 decks. Read the question aloud to the opposite team. Start the 30 second timer. Answer the question on a slip of paper provided. Fold up the slip of paper and turn it in the moderator or team captain. Read the response aloud. Discuss and deliberate on the LEAST favorite response of all the responses. The best answer is awarded 3 pts, second best answer is awarded 2 pts, and the 3rd best will receive 1 pt. After six (6) rounds, you will tally up the points. The one with the most points from each side will be crowned as the Last 2 Standing.

Every player on the board is on the same playing field...physically. Now it's time to stand out mentally, personally, and of course... sexually. Last 2 Standing aims to make your dating relationships easier. Additionally, the last one standing from both sides will be hailed as the most idealistic man and woman for dating! You don't believe me... well GET IN THE GAME!

name.value: We Happy Few: The Battle of Agincourt

item.description:
From the publisher:

Just in time for its 600th Anniversary in October of 2015, Tiny Battle Publishing is proud to present "the only Agincourt game you'll ever need", Tom Russell's We Happy Few. Using a modified version of the Shields & Swords medieval battle system, it recreates one of the most famous battles of the Middle Ages.

Near a place called Agincourt, Henry V of England and the exhausted, disease-ridden remnants of his army took on a French force the size of which vastly outnumbered his own, and proceeded to wipe the floor with 'em. The French may have had the numbers, the knights, and the horses, but Hal had a strong defensive position and the all-important English longbow. The French sneered at the bowmen as only Frenchmen can, but like the man said, don't nock it until you've tried it.

Chief among the game's features is a clever, speedy, and diceless alternative to opportunity/reaction fire concepts that reflects the difficulties inherent in moving under missile fire. This results in a very tough game for the French Player. The English Player is favored to recreate the historical result, but it's not a stroll in the park.

Like other titles in the Shields & Swords series, We Happy Few is an ideal introduction to wargaming, but with just enough grit to satisfy the seasoned counter-clipper.

item.description:
Blood Before Richmond is a series of games recreating some of the Seven Days Battles fought between George B. McClellan’s Army of the Potomac and the Confederate Army of Northern Virginia, under its daring new commander, Robert E. Lee. McClellan squandered a numerical advantage by demonstrating what would become a characteristic knack for turning tactical victories into strategic failures. Lee’s ambitious battle plans were hindered by subordinates who seemed incapable of carrying them out - chief among them, oddly, the usually exemplary Stonewall Jackson. If either side had been up to snuff, the war might have been decided in Late June 1862. Tiny Battle Publishing is proud to present this series of quick-playing, medium-complexity games about these fascinating and overlooked battles of the American Civil War, starting with Gaines's Mill.

Our first game in the series focuses on the only Confederate victory of the Seven Days. Despite the atypical outcome, it ticks off all the boxes on your Seven Days Bingo Card (just like the dice, it’s not included). Lee’s ambitious battle plan was abandoned late in the day for piecemeal frontal assaults on well-entrenched Union defensive positions. Jackson twiddled his thumbs for most of the battle, only appearing when Lee met with him personally to coordinate a final all-out assault. This managed to break the Union line, which might have held had the paranoid McClellan not held back vital reinforcements until the last possible moment.

A modified 2d6 die roll determines which Confederate divisions activate on a given turn. Divisions that didn't pull their weight are less likely to show up than those that did most of the fighting. It's a simple, clever, and elegant way to recreate the difficulties that Lee had during the Seven Days, and it creates the frustrating and tantalizing possibility that Jackson could do something if he'd only show up.

Blood Before Richmond builds on the same "stacks of steps" combat system introduced in Tom Russell's Blood on the Alma (2012). Flipping a counter over when you take a hit just doesn't capture the feel of bloody infantry collisions or the horrifying impact of artillery fire. This system uses step counters stacked beneath an identifying counter to account for brutal attrition and devastating wipe-outs.

item.description:
Latice is a strategy game where you match tiles by color and shape. The game comes with a game board, stones, and acrylic tiles. Most of the tiles contain one of six images (e.g., turtle, leaf, lizard, dolphin) in one of six colors. There are also a few special wind tiles. The game is for 2-4 players, who will evenly split the tiles. You win by being the first player to play all of your tiles.

The first player selects one tile from their rack and places it in the center square on the board. The next player, and then each in turn, can add one tile to the board, but that tile must be set adjacent to one or more existing tiles, and it must match each adjacent tile based on either color or shape. If you match more than one tile, or you place your tile on one of the sun squares on the board, you get stones that can be traded in for extra moves, allowing you to get rid of your tiles faster. You can also use the special wind tiles to move a tile already on the board over by one square.

As you play Latice, you’ll learn to plan your turns and extra moves ahead of time. You’ll strategically use wind tiles to alter the layout of the board, and play both offensively and defensively based on your knowledge of the remaining tiles. Latice has no language, culture, age or gender barriers and can be played by just about anyone. It offers strategic gameplay for adults while still being simple enough for younger players.

name.value: Wreck Age: Showdown at Burnt Tierra Gulch

item.description:
Showdown at Burnt Tierra Gulch is a 2 player starter set that will get you right into the action.

The caravan paths and walking trails through The Wilds take many travelers through Burnt Tierra Gulch. Due to the high rate of traffic, it holds strategic significance to both the Stitchers and the Drifters in the Area.

Playing Showdown at Burnt Tierra Gulch will determine who will control the gulch, and in turn, the resources that flow through it.

This box set includes 5 Drifters and 3 Stitchers and stats for all 8 models, as well as 4 pieces of resin terrain, a scenario pack, quickstart rules, and waypoint tokens.

Invaders from Dimension X! is a solitaire game (with a two-player option) that begins the story of the brutal war between the invading alien Kay’otz race and the only human force capable of defeating them – the “Old Reprobates” of the 124th Galactic Marine Raider Battalion. You control the various Marine squads, each with a specialized skill, as they fight their way through an alien enemy that is totally unpredictable. The Kay’otz come from another dimension of space and do not behave in a way humans can comprehend. Only with perseverance and skillful strategy – and yes, some good fortune – will you be able to eventually discover the plans and tactics of these mysterious beings.

Invaders from Dimension X! is an easy game to play and is suitable for players 12 years old and up. There are two Battle scenarios and one Campaign scenario included in the game and each can be completed in about an hour or two (depending on the scenario played). This game package contains one map sheet (with two separate maps printed front and back), eighty-eight counters and one 8-page rule book. You will need to provide some six-sided dice to play the game – along with enough backbone, brains and wits to defeat this vile alien enemy.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: Beyond the Gates of Antares: Strike Vector One – The Xilos Horizon

item.description:
Strike Vector One: The Xilos Horizon is the starter set for Beyond the Gates of Antares. This set contains everything you need to start gaming including complete tabletop wargame rules, army lists, battle scenarios and two opposing forces: the Concord and the Ghar.


 Launch Edition of the box game contains the hardback rulebook and launch edition miniature, available for a limited time
 Developed from the award winning Bolt Action game system and dynamic turn system
 Written by Rick Priestley, creator of Warhammer 40,000
 In depth gaming universe with epic background
 Quality multi pose plastic models within the game with an ever expanding range of plastic, metal and resin models available
 Mature games system, perfect for small skirmish actions through to large scale battles
 Builds on the existing Beyond the Gates of Antares range

link.value: Beyond the Gates of Antares: Strike on Kar'a Nine

item.description:
From the publisher:

Taking fantasy gaming back to its roots, Otherworld Fantasy Skirmish has all you need to enjoy old school table-top action using the fantastic Otherworld Miniatures range. The rules are designed for fast-moving, all-action games, allowing you to play a band of battle-hardened adventurers or a tribe of marauding monsters.

Otherworld Fantasy Skirmish is set in a fantasy world from the golden age of gaming, and uses state of the art rules and game mechanics to bring you the ultimate in dungeon adventure.

Suitable for beginners and veteran gamers alike, the fast-moving action:engine is a simple and elegant game system that gives your gaming encounters an epic atmosphere and depth of strategy.

Many of the denizens of the Otherworld are here. Choose from over 100 classic characters, monsters and minions to build your factions, from adventurers and acolytes, orcs and ogres, demons and dragons, and many more besides!

Wield arcane magic with mighty spells and enchanted artifacts. Experience thrilling adventures packed with unexpected encounters – wandering monsters, treacherous traps and the promise of a fabulous treasure glinting in the darkness…

Learn to play with a short introductory skirmish game. Then try six fast-play encounters packed with danger, before taking on the Tales of Dragon Rock campaign that includes pick-up-and-play factions for a series of three linked adventures.

This expandable game system allows you to add new abilities, spells, magic items and minions, to customise your factions and create your own exciting fantasy skirmish games.

The object of the game is to reach Sapphire Castle and save the crystal babbie cotton tail.Who has been turned to stone by the evil villain rock slide. Ages 3 & up. Spin your way to the finish, teleport across the board and collect gems on this fantasy adventure to save a friend.

Sapphire Castle mixes learning and fun. Children will learn basic phonics by recognizing shapes, numbers and counting their 123's.

In Smile & Money you should try to take more cards as possible. Play a card and take a card of the same color from the table. Each card has a coins value. Be careful; at the end of the game the coins count as points.
Who has the most points win the game!

Very easy to learn, simple to play and a nice game for everybody!!!

Similar game play as seen in Casino and Scopa

Dice Bazaar is a 2-4 player, family friendly, dice game in which players compete to purchase the most valuable products at the bazaar.

On your turn, roll your six player dice. Use those dice, plus any items you've already purchased, to pay for goods like spices, tea kettles, pottery and gems, each of which have a certain appraised value.

Each time a player makes a purchase, the merchant changes his prices by re-rolling his Price Dice. Once two items are sold out, the merchant goes home for the day. The shopper that got the most valuable items for their money is victorious!

Mechanics:
• Dice Rolling
• Press your luck
• Trading
• Set Collection

The Game is a realpolitik boardgame where the players step into the role of the most influential people of the planet, the ones who control governments and nations. To win the player must avoid to identify himself with a faction such as North America, the Soviet Union or the Middle East. These factions should be "puppets" that the player must maneuver to get richer than other players.

During a play of The Game players manage governments, banks, religious congregation and mass-media, creating conflicts, speculations, war debts and political scandals. These events can decree the well-being or the failure of the world factions, provoking wars, truces and weapons trade. It doesn't matter if the factions controlled by the player prosper or suffer: the winner will be the player who benefits the more from the world situation: when you sell weapons you can win even losing the war.

Some notes regarding actual game mechanics, actions and win conditions.

There are six factions: Europe (black), USA (blue), Sovietic Area (red), Chinese Area (yellow), Arabian area (green) and Third World area (white). Players are not associated to factions but they control them. From this point of view the game paradigma remembers Imperial.

The game is played in turns. During each turn a player draw one card from the common deck, then can play one card from his hand. Other players could play also a card during current player's turn, but this is not mandatory and not often worthy. Part of the strategy relies on the decision about if, when and what to play during the turn of another player. Aside from the card, each money holds some money, which can be spend during the game and it's considered as victory points at the end of the game.

The deck contains 72 cards. 24 cards are named "Controls" and are permanent cards, i.e. they remain on the table after being played. The other 48 cards are temporary cards, i.e they are discarded after their effect took place. All cards are of four types: Military Control, Economic Control, Mass-Media Control and Religious Control. Since we have 6 factions and 4 type of control cards, this makes up the 24 control cards. The other 48 cards are also divided into these 4 categories (Military, Economic, Mass-Media and Religious) but, as stated above, they are temporary.

After playing a card, and carried on its effects (if not permanent) the current player can activate all his permanent cards. Each card allow differect actions.
A military control card allows to move military units on the map, triggering wars and occupations among the 6 factions. Economic control cards allow to directly attack another player (not a faction) by stealing his money. Mass-Media control cards allows to move tokens from any position, changing the "meaning" of the token. This is probably the most innovative game concept: by activate a Mass-Media control a player can take a token from a Military card (depicting a was loss) and move it to a Economic card (depicting a return of investment). By this mechanism the player can use the power of Mass-Media to change the way facts are explained to people, and then changing the way the history events affects social groups. Finally, Religious control allows to steal a control card from another player: this is probably the most powerful card, but it's not always easy to manage.

Player roll dice only when manipulating factions. Factions are not balanced, and this is the game's core logic. For instance, a player controlling blue Military Control (USA Military control), white Economic Control (Third World control) and red Mass-Media Control (Sovietic Mass-Media Control) could decide to trigger a war between USA and Sud Africa, being almost sure that USA military forces will win easily. This could create a debt to his white Economic control card, and then he could use his red Mass-Media control to move this tokens away from white Economic card to another card of his own. An historical lecture of these strategy could be read as follows: in the real history USA won a war against Sud Africa, but russian Mass-Media managed to tell another version of facts, and this could produce a money income for the player controlling russians Mass-Media enterprises.

Playing The Game should give players the same feeling you can get by movies as "Wag the Dog" (1997) or from the historical events as the attack to the World Trade Center (2001). Players should manipulate factions, sometime carrying them to financial crises, war or destruction, in order to enrich themself (and not the faction). The game ends when a player reaches the victory condition or the deck runs out of cards. At the end of the game the richest player is the winner.

King Arthur went off to war against the Saxons and left his kingdom ruled by its allies.

Players must influence the various characters of Great Britain, as Merlin, Morgana, Lancelot, Mordred, Guinevere, to achieve infiltrate his knights at Camelot, and thus have more chances to succeed to the throne.

Meanwhile, players must send resources to supply King Arthur and thus keep up high with the legendary monarch.

Players use up to 6 knights each in 8 to 10 game rounds, to influence the characters, gather resources and ship other resources to help King Arthur.

link.value: The Legend of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table

item.description:
War of Cakes is a competitive game where you will face other players in a pastry aggressive competition. During the game you have to build pies with ingredients and recipes that you get during the game, but beware! the other participants can ruin your creations. Nata, dynamite, chocolate or barbed wire are just some of the ingredients that we use to achieve first place in the contest.

War of Cakes it is a turn-based game. It is a card game consisting of a deck of ingredients and other recipes. On each turn the player may draw cards and put recipes you want to build. Each player has their own cakes, but the recipes can be placed on any cake. First put the recipe and then you are adding ingredients, turn by turn. Every player is required to use an ingredient in their turn (whenever possible). An ingredient can be used on their own or others recipes.

In short, to put a piece of cake in a cake we need to take several steps:

1) Put the recipe under construction.
2) Adding the necessary ingredients
3) Put the cake recipe.

They are not used dice or the like. The strategy is that players are required to use at least one ingredient per shift. And if not well managed, it can finish putting on good ingredients good recipes from other players.

This makes it a semi-cooperative game. There are also recipes for cakes remaining points.

From the publisher:

Hello Future Movie Producer!

Do you have what it takes to become the next big movie Production Company? Grab your production dice, and start rolling, releasing movies, winning awards and making millions in Box Office Blowout!

GAME OVERVIEW
Box Office Blowout is a satirical movie building game for 2-4 players. Each players takes on the role of a Movie Production Company seeking to rake in the most cash through releasing movies and winning awards. Produce your movie by rolling the Production Dice to contract directors, hire actors and actresses, build sets, gather film crew, and manipulate critics. The player who earns the most money after releasing 3 or 4 movies is the winner.

WHAT MAKES THIS GAME AWESOME?
Build huge blockbusters or crank out B-movies! Choose your strategy of how you will make money and control the tempo of the game.

Manipulate critics to boost your movie or slander your rivals'! Who knew that critics where so easily persuaded? Critic cards are powerful and add a fun "take that" to your movie building experience.
 Win awards to Blowout the Box Office! Increase the amount of money your production company makes by winning awards. More people will come see your movie when you get your grubby little hands on an award.

name.value: Angels and Demons: Battle for Humanity

item.description:
INTRODUCTION:
In the small hamlet of Foix, stands a castle that has stood for centuries. Little do the townsfolk know that they will shortly be part of an ongoing battle between two epic forces. Angels and Demons, disguised in human form, have entered this once quiet haven.

Will Demons raze the town, leaving a trail of devastation? Will Angels draw out all that is good, leaving a barren landscape? Or, do the townsfolk of this once peaceful town stand a chance to hold on to everything they hold dear?

DESCRIPTION:
Angels and Demons is a party game for 6-25 players who each receive a role combination (character type and alignment) defining their faction. Each night someone is eliminated from the game, and the town exiles another player during the day.

GAME OBJECTIVE:
Keep alive until you eliminate opposing factions

GAMEPLAY:
Players each receive a character card (human, angel, or demon), and an alignment card (good or evil). These combinations determine your role. Each role is kept hidden, and players are eliminated during each of the day and night cycles.

GAME ELEMENTS:

 Hidden roles
 Multiple ways to win
 Humans belong to families who are aware of each other

name.value: Duelo Primigenio: The Rainbow Shoushiling Cards Project

item.description:
Duelo Primigenio A new design in a multi-game deck . 
The main feature of the deck is the use of the reverse of the cards in the mechanichs of the games. In this deck the reverse shows the color of the front of the card, something very simple that has enabled us to unlock a lot of innovative mechanical to design games exclusively for this deck.

Spanish description: 
Un nuevo concepto en baraja de cartas, donde los colores y los reversos de las cartas tienen un papel muy relevante .Los reversos de las cartas no son iguales como en una baraja tradicional, muestran el color del anverso.

item.description:
A Prehistoric game for all young dinosaurs

NasconDino is a fun family game that has been handed down generation after generation since the first dinosaur times!
There are two game modes: "Memory!" or "Speed".

Memory is the prehistoric implementation of the classic "turn two tiles, keep if they are the same".

In the "Speed" version of the game one player throws two dice that show a color each. All players try to grab the only two dinosaur that have the same two colors. The player who conquers a predetermined amount of dinosaurs wins the game.

The box contains 2 dice with colored sides, 36 dinosaur tiles and the rulebook.

A wonderfull two player game. One player gets to be the thief and one the policeman. Each player moves and then places coloured pieces on the board, in order to block his opponent. When the policeman or the thief is completely blocked, the game ends!

You and your friends are Dwarf Lords leading an expedition to a remote mountain, rich in resources the Dwarf Kingdoms need. You each lead a group of Dwarven Miners and workers as they delve deep into the heart of the mountain. You goal is to establish a new, powerful and wealthy Dwarven kingdom and become King under the Mountain.

Each turn you will send your Dwarf Workers out to mine through the mountain, build buildings, craft jewelry, ingots, coins, and armor. You make all the decisions, no dice to determine what resources you receive. Do you mine that gold and mint coins to lure more dwarf workers to come to your banner? Or do you harvest gems to start building your hoard of jewelry?

Resources located in the tiles include:
Iron ore
Raw Gems
Gold Ore
Coal

Items which can be built as cards you hold include:
Steel ingots
Gold Ingots
Cut Gem Piles
Gold Coin Piles
Warrior Gear
Jewelry Piles.

These are produced in the following buildings which are placed onto the table as tiles, replacing caverns and mines: 
Smelter
Jewelers shop
Smithy
Mint
Armory

But plan your realm layout carefully, at some point your delving will converge with those of your competitors. At that time the game changes and you will need Warriors to defend your fledgling realm. Or you may even decide to go on the attack denying the enemy their buildings and resources.

Through the building of a mighty military or a greed inspiring pile of jewelry you can become the King Under the Mountain.

Bola has twelve double-sided cards, with each card showing a colored ball on each side. The balls come in eight colors, and each color appears three times. Each turn, one card is flipped to its opposite side, and whoever succeeds in finding three balls of the same color scores a point. Whoever first scores five points wins!

Dice Of Debt is a "serious game" designed to help software development teams deal with the common problem of technical debt. If you're not familiar with the concept, technical debt is the drag on productivity that sloppy coding and testing create. Teams sometimes have to take shortcuts, but they pay the price, in the long term. Here's where to get it: http://www.game-change-llc.com/diceofdebt/

Teams often have a hard time justifying to their management, or to themselves, the investment needed to reduce technical debt. Fixing the existing code, or implementing practices that improve the quality of future code, have a cost. Under time pressures, and with an unclear picture of how much of a drag on productivity technical debt really is, teams are hesitant to make a hard choice, even if it increases the amount of software value that the team will eventually deliver.

The game simulates the work of an Agile software team over the course of 10 sprints. (If you're not familiar with Agile, or sprints, just suffice it to say that we're talking about the work that a team can get done in a series of 10 2-week intervals.) The 12 dice used in the game represent the team's capacity, which is split between coding new features and dealing with the burden of technical debt. You roll one set of dice to represent the value of the new features, then subtract the total from the roll of another set of dice to represent the burden of technical debt.

The players (working cooperatively, since they're the team) can decide to implement measures that will reduce technical debt. Either the pool of technical debt dice will get smaller, or you will subtract from the final result of rolling these dice. You have to set aside some time and effort to implement these technical debt-reducing measures, so your capacity for coding new features will drop temporarily.

The goal of the game is to produce the largest amount of new software value (features) by the end of the game (again, 10 turns, representing "sprints"). There's no specific "win" condition, other than to see how much better you can do, in the end, than if you had taken no action to reduce technical debt.

The real victory the players can achieve is a good conversation about what they might do, in their own work on software teams, to reduce technical debt. Now that they've seen the long-term productivity gain they can achieve from a short-term productivity loss, it will become easier to justify the difficult choices.

The game is not designed to provide an extremely accurate simulation of the benefits that each technical debt-reducing measure might provide. However, it does simulate other aspects of decision-making about technical debt. For example, the players can see how important it is to invest earlier rather than later in reducing technical debt. In these ways, the game also provides simulation value.

Dice Of Debt is going to be part of a package of materials that the Agile Alliance is producing to help people combat technical debt. We will post more specifics when we have them. The current plan is to publish this package by the end of 2015.

Monster Math Munch is an educational math game for children in grades 4 to 6. Each player places their game piece on the start of their own track. The first player chooses a card an reads the math problem on the card to the player to their left. If that player answers correctly he or she moves one space forward. Play continues to the left until one player reaches the end space of the track, winning the game.

In Cul-De-Sac Conquest players compete to annoy each other out of their neighborhood.

Everyone plays an annoying neighbor who can aggravate their neighbors with loud barking dogs or persistent Christmas carolers, they can relax their own characters by meditating or watching TV in bed, they can upgrade their houses with hot tubs or game rooms and sometimes accidentally annoy themselves by stubbing their toe or getting a parking ticket.

Once a character reaches their rage meter they are out of the game.

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: Bubble Guppies Fin-tastic Field Trip Game

item.description:
From the box:
"8 place to visit, 4 games to play! Use the 4 double-sided game boards individually to play a fast-placed, token-collecting game. OR, put them together to make your very own game board and the race begins! Collect tokens from each area and be the first one home, to win."

Bubble Guppies Fin-Tastic Field Trip Game is a spin-and-move game where players move their characters around the track, collecting tokens. The board is modular and may be reassembled in different configurations. Each section represents a particular location, such as a museum, farm or supermarket. The object of the game is to visit each location and collect a token from each before returning to the starting space. To make the game more challenging, tokens can be placed face-down to add a memory element.

There are also three other versions to play the game included. In Gil's Game, players must claim tokens held up by a game leader by matching them to pictures on their board. The first player to fill his or her board wins. Molly's Memory Game is a re-theme of the classic matching game Memory. In Mr. Grouper's What's Missing? Game, players take turns playing the role of Mr. Grouper. Mr. Grouper lays out five tiles. After looking at them, other players close their eyes and Mr. Grouper removes one tile. Players in turn try to identify the missing tile. The first player to identify the tile wins it. The next player to the left then becomes Mr. Grouper. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: Brainy Quiz Contest is a trivia game for children, published in India. Each player has a token which they move along a track. On each space, they spin a spinner to choose a trivia question category. Then the quiz master chooses a card and asks them a multiple-choice question in the category chosen. If the answer is wrong, the player must choose a "punishment" card requiring them to do some sort of stunt. If the answer is correct, the player moves forward and answers another question, continuing until a wrong answer is given. The first player to reach the end of the track wins, gaining the winner's crown and prize check.

CalculoDingo is a goldmine that will accompany your children or students (particularly teachers' aides) in kindergarten and older

The game CalculoDingo offers 15 different rules with the same set of cards. These rules allow to practice counting, additions, subtractions and doubling.
 In CalculoDingo you will find the concepts in counting: recognize numbers, compare numbers, insert one number between two others, make sequences of numbers, parity, the decimal system (units and tens).

4 aliens disembark from their spaceship to study our language.

Gameplay: 200 words with their definitions, anagrams and riddles.

Give the right answers and win the most of vocabulary words.

A comical game to enrich the vocabulary of kindergardeners all the way to adults!

A fun game to learn about fractions!. Master representations of fractions and their additions.
 A playful tool organised into 3 levels of difficulty.
Play the battle, Rummy and the Mistigri to help pirates to share their treasure.

Ideal for CE1 and CE2, here are 5 rules different games (Battle, 
Rummy, Mistigri, SpeedoSyno and DevineMoi) to learn 200 words.

Each word, in addition to its definition, has a synonym and two antonyms.
 For example: friend → ally, foe, opponent.
 A fun tool that increases in difficulty, to enrich the vocabulary for second graders onward.

Following the great success of Vocadingo for kindergardeners, here is a new comical game to enrich vocabulary children 9 and over.
 Four aquatic heroes arrive to study our language.
 Gameplay: 200 words each with its definition, its anagram and its riddle!

Give the right answers and win the most vocabulary cards!

Learn Phonics from a playful perspective! 
 Consisting of 102 maps words, Sonodingo is a scalable game with 5 different levels. For each level, there is, for each card, a card that begins with the same syllable and a card that ends up the same syllable.
 Simple and traditional games as mistigri, Rummy, the battle... give a touch of fun to approach the phonology. 
 Important step in the establishment of phonological awareness, and the process of learning to read, Sonodingo can be used from the large section of kindergarten for learning of phonetic syllables. In CP/CE1, we can also use the spelling of the words corresponding to the phonetic syllables to make understand the existence of different spellings for a phonetic syllable.
 A clever system of verification helps children to correct themselves. Parents and teachers will also appreciate the beautiful illustrations and the affordable price of Sonodingo.

Two inspectors must rebuild 700 vocabulary words from 96 letters and syllables.

Play the battle, Rummy and the Caterpillar to help reconstruct the words.

Sylladingo is a fun tool to enrich the vocabulary of the CP to the CM1. The game includes 2 packs of different cards (easy and hard levels).

Conjudingo includes 3 easy and fun games to practice the present, future simple and past compound tenses with kids the CE1 to the CM1.

The different animals on the cards help you verify whether the combination is correct

Conjudingo is the practical and comical tool for all conjugations in the CE1 program.

Conjudingo CE2 includes 3 games easy and fun to work the verbs of the 2nd and 3rd groups present, future and imperfect (auxiliary, 1st, 2nd and 3rd groups) with the children of CE2 in the CM1. The different animals on the maps help you verify whether the combination is good.

Conjudingo is the practical and playful tool for all conjugations of the elementary school curriculum.

Have fun building words using syllables categorized by frequency they are used in the French language. Play 4 different minigames including 'Top list' that allows players of all ages to play together and to use texts as a resource.
 A fun way to enhance writing and vocabulary of the CP to CM2 students (grades 1 and 2, roughly)!

Collect the ladybugs and katydids while avoiding stink bugs and other destructive bugs

The game play mechanics are simple. It's a collecting game that involves 52 cards of mostly insects and other creatures of the yard. What makes this game unique and different from your average trick taking game is that you don't just add your points up when all cards have been played. There's a damage phase that takes place when scoring and certain cards (or bugs) will eat other bugs. There are many different combinations of scoring that can happen depending on what you collect.

Flying Saucers Junior is simpler version of the game Flying Saucers. It has less fields on the board and only first level of Flying Saucers, with less figurines.

Figurines represent different categories of flying saucers, which differ in speed, size and power. Flying saucers destroy enemy saucers by stopping next to it. Flying saucer with more power, or joined multiple saucers can destroy enemy flying saucer. The goal of the game is to destroy the main enemy flying saucer.

The game can be played with dice or without it.
